snippet.text: jQuery Mobile is a touch-optimized framework (iOS and Android are currently best supported) that uses jQuery and jQuery UI for its foundation. Today, John Resig has announced a second alpha release and suggests a final 1.0 release will occur in January 2011

jQuery 1.4.4 has been released and focuses on basic tweaks and bugfixes. The only new feature is a new Effects function called fadeToggle() that brings built-in toggling to fading effects. jQuery 1.5 is now the team's focus with an early 2011 release in the works

articles.title: Infrastructure Company Joyent Invests in Node.js

snippet.text: node.js founder Ryan Dahl reports that he has made an 'agreement with Joyent that officially puts Node under their roof' with the company sponsoring his work on the popular JavaScript framework

articles.title: New Firefox 4 Beta Boasts Crazy JavaScript Performance

snippet.text: Mozilla has rolled out a new Firefox 4 beta release with the biggest improvements coming in JavaScript and graphics performance. Firefox 4's JavaScript engine now clocks in at between 3-5 times faster than 3.6.12 on various JavaScript benchmarks. Also, WebGL (think Canvas but 3D) support is now enabled by default
Yahoo! developer Tom Hughes-Croucher has announced a preview release of his upcoming book, Up and Running With Node.js. It's still early days with only about 25 pages shared but it shows promise
Yahoo has announced a new YUI Test project with a goal to create a complete JavaScript testing solution that encompasses all parts of the testing process. It even includes a Selenium driver

articles.title: Rebecca Murphey Offering jQuery Fundamentals Course

snippet.text: jQuery guru Rebecca Murphey has teamed up with CodeLesson to offer a jQuery Fundamental course, starting in January 2011. It costs $395 but you get four weeks of jQuery tuition and Rebecca will be on hand throughout

articles.title: Building a Simple Node.js Web Service [Video]

snippet.text: Keir Whitaker presents a 10 minute video on building a simple Web service (to perform operations on numbers) with Node.js. Compellingly short, and he says "huge dump" half way through too
Justin Meyer presents a walkthrough of using JavaScriptMVC to organize a jQuery-based JavaScript app, based around the separation of concerns

articles.title: Roll your own PubSub with DNode

snippet.text: with JavaScript and Node.js
The third in a series of great articles by Tim Caswell digging into JavaScript's object system. This time around, Tim compares JavaScript's object model to that of Ruby
Sami Samhuri tears apart 37signals' purely Web based "Chalk" drawing app and looks at how it works. A good teardown of a well designed but small JavaScript and HTML5 project

Charles Leifer presents a quick demo of a "starfield" effect (think the intro to Star Trek) built using JavaScript and Canvas. The code is shown inline and provides a short, well structured example of producing a basic Canvas-based effect

articles.title: Listing Your GitHub Projects using JavaScript

snippet.text: Andrew Davey demonstrates how to create a simple JavaScript widget to put on your site in order to show off your GitHub projects

articles.title: Building a GameBoy Emulator in JavaScript

snippet.text: Not new this week but this series of articles about building a Nintendo GameBoy emulator in JavaScript is a compelling and on-going project

articles.title: Introducing node-canvas - A Server-side HTML 5 Canvas API

snippet.text: Node-canvas is a Cairo-backed Canvas implementation for Node.js. Essentially, imagine the typical browser-based Canvas API but having it server side. It comes with several great examples

articles.title: jsii - Full Text Search in 1000 Lines of JavaScript

snippet.text: jsii provides an in-memory inverted index within approx 1000 lines of JavaScript. Some more lines are necessary to set up a server via node.js, so that the index is queryable via http and returns Solr-compatible JSON or XML

articles.title: backbone-couchdb: Give your CouchDB app some Backbone

snippet.text: backbone-couchdb is a Backbone.js connector that overrides the default sync-behavior of Backbone and connects your app to your CouchDB database. The result? You don't have to write any server-side if you don't want to
Sergi Mansilla is working on a JavaScript library to let you produce MIDI files that you can play directly in the browser. It's very new and support is patchy but an interesting project nonetheless

DNode is a node.js library for asynchronous, bidirectional remote method invocation across the network. Transports for network sockets and WebSocket-style socket.io connections are available. Think Ruby's DRb but for JavaScript (and on steroids

Snippet is a jQuery syntax highlighting plugin built on top of the SHJS script. Snippet provides a quick and easy way of highlighting source code passages (in languages like C, CSS, HTML, Ruby, XML, SQL, Python and more) in HTML documents
provides a barrage of proven high performance, enterprise-level and scalable JavaScript tips and best practices. Or not
